page.title: 10SOUTH CREAKE, NORTH NORFOLK
page.content: South Creake is a village in the valley of the River Burn, in N Norfolk, low rainfall, on well drained chalk. Its situation, six miles from the market town of Fakenham, has caused closure of shops, except the post office and butchers. It has a recreation ground, no village hall. Part of a former brewery, used as a social club, has a small room for use of local organisations. There is no employment, other than agricultural, so the village has become a dormitory for people working in Norwich, Fakenham or Kings Lynn. Many inhabitants are elderly. The present imbalance between the residents who provide the permanency, and the floating population who enliven, would increase, if the village junior school were to be closed.
